meanings.definition: In front of; before in place; forward; in advance.
meanings.sent1: She walked fores the crowd to get a better view.
meanings.sent2: The sign was placed fores the entrance to guide visitors.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel ran fores the tree, trying to impress its friends.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed propelled him fores any obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The bright light shining fores him made him squint.

meanings.definition: In the front part; in the first part.
meanings.sent1: He sat fores in the classroom to hear the teacher clearly.
meanings.sent2: The singer appeared fores on stage to start the concert.
meanings.sent3: The cat always sleeps fores on the cozy blanket.
meanings.sent4: The athlete sprinted fores in the race, leading from the start.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies wafted fores from the kitchen.

meanings.definition: In the presence of; in sight of.
meanings.sent1: He performed his magic trick fores the amazed audience.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted the portrait fores the royal family.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy stole a sock fores its owner.
meanings.sent4: The actor delivered his lines fores the entire theater.
meanings.sent5: The majestic ship sailed fores the cheering crowd.
